so how much more of that fossilized

not much
think of it as a carbon budget
we are currently adding 55 billion
metric tons of greenhouse gases to the

this is the gigaton challenge
by some estimates at that pace we will
have burned through the remaining budget
so to give us some room to breathe the
world must reduce greenhouse gas
pollution by more than seven percent

starting now
there are a number of ways to do that

there's also nitrous oxide known as

methane is better at trapping the sun's

if methane emissions from agriculture
and the oil and gas industry can be

co2 has a longer life once it is added

adding no more co2 to the air by 2050
and that means transforming the modern

there are several ways to break down the

data
start with energy the majority of modern

makes the energy sector 76 of the

used for transportation industrial

the shift to clean energy must be
accelerated by an order of magnitude if

and we'll need more ways to store this

batteries in clean hydrogen are also

around
eight percent from cars five percent

with abundant clean electricity the

then there are our lifestyles and

all told these materials account for six

and we'll need new and clean ways to

to truly solve the climate challenge the
